title: How to Make a Cobra With Plastic String

steps.title: Choose any color string you want.
steps.content: Choose any color string you want. Pick 3 to 4 strands of string. Only two of the strands will be used, however - the remaining strands will simply be used as a central strand. If done correctly, the central strand will not be able to be seen at all, so use a color you do not care about.

steps.title: Cut the strands to length.
steps.content: Cut the strands to length. Remember that the finished bracelet will be about 2 inches (5.1 cm) shorter than the length of the central strand, so cut the string accordingly. For the two working strands, cut a length that is about four times the length of the central strand.

steps.title: Make a starter stitch at the top.
steps.content: Make a starter stitch at the top. Tie the two working strands together in a loose granny knot. Stick the end of the central strands into one of the outer knots and pull slightly through. Tighten the granny knot.

steps.title: Take two pieces from the folded string.
steps.content: Take two pieces from the folded string. With one of them, make a loop and put it in the front.

steps.title: Take one of the working strands.
steps.content: Take one of the working strands. You will always start with this strand.

steps.title: Make a loop over the central strand.
steps.content: Make a loop over the central strand.

steps.title: Place the other strand over the loop and pass it behind the central strand and through the loop you made with the first strand.
steps.content: Place the other strand over the loop and pass it behind the central strand and through the loop you made with the first strand.

steps.title: Repeat.
steps.content: Repeat. Remember to always start with the same strand. Continue until you form a length long enough to turn into a bracelet.

steps.title: Take two pieces of different color gimp.
steps.content: Take two pieces of different color gimp. The first piece is the working strand and the second piece is the inner string.

steps.title: Take the second piece.
steps.content: Take the second piece. Make a small loop in the middle and hold it.

steps.title: Take the working strand and put it sideways, placing the middle part behind the bottom of the loop.
steps.content: Take the working strand and put it sideways, placing the middle part behind the bottom of the loop.

steps.title: Take the right strand and toss it over to the other side.
steps.content: Take the right strand and toss it over to the other side. Make a very small hole in the right side with out letting go. Don't forget to hold on to the right strand after tossing it over.

steps.title: Take the left strand next.
steps.content: Take the left strand next. Put it through the hole on the right, in much the same way. You have now made your first stitch.

steps.title: Do the same thing over and over until the length is as desired.
steps.content: Do the same thing over and over until the length is as desired.

steps.title: Finished.
steps.content: Finished. It can now be tied together to form a bracelet or other item.
